reasoning: Secondary antiphospholipid syndrome occurs in 1-2% of patients with systemic lupus erythematosus and other autoimmune diseases. Given SLE prevalence of ~40 per 100k, estimated secondary APS incidence ~0.5 per 100k. Limited specific epidemiological studies on secondary APS as distinct entity from primary APS.
source: Rheumatology literature on antiphospholipid syndrome epidemiology
